Beyond day 10 after symptom onset there is little residual risk of infectivity, based on cell culture of upper respiratory tract specimens, despite residual viral RNA shedding detected by RT-PCR.
100 The median range of SARS-CoV-2 viral shedding among patients with COVID-19 may indeed be up to 20 days from symptoms and may persist over longer periods in older persons, in those who received immunosuppressive therapy, and in those who had severe illness requiring hospitalization.
